_exec_summary.SummaryText:
THE ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES AT OUR FACILITY

THIS FACILITY COMPLIES WITH EPCRA 302 REQUIREMENTS FOR ANHYDROUS AMMONIA STORAGE AND IT IS OUR POLICY TO ADHERE TO ALL APPLICABLE FEDERAL, STATE, AND LOCAL LAWS.  iF AN EMERGENCY WERE TO OCCUR, IT IS OUR POLICY TO NOTIFY THE ARCHER FIRE DEPARTMENT AND REQUEST THAT THEY RESPOND TO THE EMERGENCY.  OUR POLICY ALSO IS TO EVACUATE ANY PEOPLE IN THE AREA AFFECTED AND NOTIFY THE LOCAL AND NATIONAL EMERGENCY RESPONSE CENTERS IF THE RELEASE IS MORE THAN 100#.

A DESPCRIPTION OF OUR FACILITY AND THE REGULATED SUBSTANCE HANDLED

THIS FACILITY IS A GRAIN ELEVATOR.  WE DRY AND STORE GRAIN, CUSTOM MILL FEED, AND SELL DRY FERTILIZER, LIQUID NITROGEN (28-0-0), ANHYDROUS AMMONIA, AND AG CHEMICALS.  WE ALSO CUSTOM APPLY FERTILIZER AND HERBICIDES.  WE USE ANHYDROUS AMMONIA FOR A NITROGEN SOURCE FOR FIELD CORN.  THE AMMONIA PLANT CONSISTS OF TWO STORAGE TANKS - ONE 120,000 LB. TANK AND ONE 60,000 LB. TANK AND ASSOCIATED PIPING, VALVES AND NURSE TANK CONNECTORS ON THE FILL RISERS.

THE WORST CASE RELEASE SCENARIO

OUR WORST CASE SCENARIO IS FAILURE OF AN EXCESS FLOW VALVE CAUSING A SUDDEN RELEASE OF LIQUID AND VAPOR CAUSING AN EXPLOSION.  ACCORDING TO EPA LOOK-UP TABLES, THE DISTANCE TO THE ENDPOINT IS 3.6 MILES, WITH A TOTAL POPULATION OF 373 PEOPLE.

THE GENERAL ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICAL-SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS

tHIS FACILITY COMPLIES WITH EPA'S ACCIDENT PREVENTION RULE AND ALL APPLICABLE STATE AND LOCAL CODES AND REGULATIONS.  THE ANHYDROUS AMMONIA SYSTEM IS DESIGNED, INSTALLED, AND MAINTAINED IN ACCORDANCE WITH EPCRA 302 AND ANSI STANDARDS.

FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY

WE HAVE NEVER HAD AN ACCIDENT INVOLVING ANHYDROUS AMMONIA THAT CAUSED DEATH, INJURIES, PROPERTY, OR ENVIRONMENTAL DAMAGE, EVACUATIONS OR SHELTERINGS IN PLACE.

EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM

IN THE EVENT OF AN EMERGENCY INVOLVING OUR ANHYDROUS AMMONIA SYSTEM, IT IS OUR PLICY TO NOTIFY THE ARCHER FIRE DEPARTMENT A

ND REQUEST THAT THEY RESPOND TO THE EMERGENCY.  THEN EVACUATE PEOPLE AND NOTIFY THE LOCAL AND NATIONAL RESPONSE CENTER IF THE LEAK AMOUNTS TO MORE THAN 100#.

PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY.

NONE.
